name: Royal Ontario Museum
tips: Buy tickets online to skip lines
text: Royal Ontario Museum is a large indoor museum in Downtown Toronto near subway access. It is medium priced and great for families or solo travelers. Highlights include dinosaur fossils and world culture exhibits. Plan about 2 hours and buy tickets online to skip lines.

name: Distillery District
tips: Best visited in afternoon for photos
text: Distillery District is an outdoor historic pedestrian area in Old Toronto. It is low cost and perfect for couples or friends. Expect art galleries, cafes and cobblestone streets. Best visited in the afternoon.

name: CN Tower
tips: Book tickets early morning to avoid crowds
text: CN Tower is an iconic indoor observation tower in Downtown Toronto with subway access. It is high priced but offers amazing skyline views. Expect about 1 hour visit.

name: Ripley’s Aquarium
tips: Arrive early to avoid peak crowds
text: Ripley’s Aquarium is a family friendly indoor attraction near CN Tower. Medium price and ideal for kids. Plan around 2 hours.

name: High Park
tips: Spring cherry blossom season is busiest
text: High Park is a large outdoor park accessible by subway in the West End. Free to visit and great for walking or picnics.

name: St Lawrence Market
highlights: Local food vendors, peameal bacon sandwich
text: St Lawrence Market is an indoor food market in Downtown Toronto. Low cost and perfect for food lovers. Visit before lunch rush.

name: Toronto Islands
text: Toronto Islands are outdoor islands accessible by ferry. Low cost and ideal for half day trips with biking and beaches.

name: Aga Khan Museum
text: Aga Khan Museum is an indoor museum in North York featuring Islamic art and architecture.

name: Kensington Market
text: Kensington Market is an outdoor neighborhood famous for vintage shops and street art.

name: Art Gallery of Ontario
text: Art Gallery of Ontario is a major indoor museum in Downtown Toronto with modern and Canadian art collections.

name: Casa Loma
text: Casa Loma is a historic indoor castle with impressive gardens located in Midtown Toronto. It offers guided tours and scenic views.

name: Eaton Centre
text: Eaton Centre is one of Toronto’s largest indoor shopping malls in Downtown, with extensive shops and eateries.

name: Toronto Zoo
text: Toronto Zoo has a wide range of animal exhibits and outdoor kid-friendly zones, great for a full day visit.

name: Allan Gardens
text: Allan Gardens is an indoor garden conservatory in Downtown Toronto, featuring plants from around the world.

name: Bata Shoe Museum
text: Bata Shoe Museum showcases global footwear history and is a unique indoor museum destination.

name: Hockey Hall of Fame
text: Hockey Hall of Fame has interactive exhibits and showcases the historic Stanley Cup.

text: Toronto Waterfront offers scenic outdoor walking paths, lake views and sunset spots.
